posts.name: Adam Parish
posts.cooked: Does the Signal Foundation or EFF provide any Signal merchandise we can buy?

link_counts.title: SWAG Where are my $25 shirts and $5 stickers?

posts.name: Jeremy
posts.cooked: I would totally buy some shirts
Stickers, we need stickers!

For promotion they have door “Privacy please” stickers.
Bellow picture from topic: Community Spotlight: @DonDino:

I don’t know if they are for sale or only for marketing.
Only for marketing
They actually wouldn’t be too hard to make from the look of the logo. I’ll see if I can bug my wife into making something and report back

posts.name: Jay Patel
posts.cooked: Signal team can make on Redbubble or similar platform or make their own merchandise store

jaypatelani:

make their own merchandise store

I don’t think this is the best solution. Few days ago Ubuntu Store (the most popular Linux distro) closed its doors. Running its own store probably takes too much effort for tiny amount of money flow. It is also a question if non-profit organization like Signal Foundation is able to sale products.

Maybe there could be some other way like people who donate some amount of money, can choose to get some stickers or something.

posts.name: Johanw666
posts.cooked: Although the code is open source, the logo’s and trademarks are not. But if you make your own or order it made (I don’t know how it is in other countries but in The Netherlands you get plenty of advertising from companies who will print anything on anything if you’re registered as a company) I doubt OWS will protest, Unless you’re selling it for profit of course. But if you order 100 T-shirts with the Signal logo (you have to order those merchandise usually in some quantity) and sell them for (total price) / (nr of shirts printed) there is no profit in it.

posts.name: Intr0
posts.cooked: Great idea! Definitely a great idea.

posts.name: Intr0
posts.cooked: Lol I was just thinking that stickers would be cool moments before seeing your post.

posts.name: Intr0
posts.cooked:
shellSignal:

Maybe there could be some other way like people who donate some amount of money, can choose to get some stickers or something.

Indeed. But Ubuntu had a store? Like they need the cash flow.

posts.name: Jay Patel
posts.cooked: What you can do it Open account at Redbubble create private sticker product and order with link … So it won’t be visible to public otherwise you will get profit automatically once when someone purchased product.

mozdevcontrib:

Indeed. But Ubuntu had a store? Like they need the cash flow.

The wast majority of money in Ubuntu case is from server/cloud/IoT sectors, Ubuntu store to sell T-shirts was completely nothing in case of revenue. There was just a store to sell T-shirts etc. Probably when you open such a store then there is a lot of interest. Most of the users that would like to have some article related to product, buy them relatively early after store is opened. Then most of the interested one already have a T-shirt and they don’t buy another T-shirt every month or so (T-shirts are not bread to buy it every day). The after few months/years most of the interested have had already bought the T-shirt like product and store does not sell much, so obvious is to close the store down.

The big problem is, this kind of products are intended for marketing, and not intended to be a big business out of it, but this kind of marketing like store takes a lot of time, but does not return money back to cover the expenses. Now imagine, selling T-shirts all over the world. Transportation costs would be sky-rocketing comparing to actual T-shirt value.

Maybe instead of selling the products for tiny prices, there could be done some emblems created that are offered for free. Then enthusiasts can download this emblems, go to local T-shirt printing facility and make like few copies out of it and have them for self promotion.

Maybe we as community could came to some ideas:

  • I am just a signal away.
  • Signal me if you dare.
  • I am using Signal, and I am proud of it (gay like style).
  • Privacy please. Signal only.
  • Signal on board (like car sticker children on board).
  • You spy, I Signal. You struggle, I laugh.
  • Secure, private, convenient. Signal in did.
  • Skype, Telegram, Messenger, Whatsapp, Snapchat, Viber… A lot of crowd, but only one of perfection. Signal.

posts.name: ⚠️ abandoned account ⚠️
posts.cooked:
I also suggest:

  • send a Signal!
  • Respect the privacy of others! + Signal-Logo

but
a) “Privacy please. Signal only.” - well “Signal only” is to hard. There are other apps like Briar, Conversations that offer even more privacy.
b) “Skype, …A lot of crowd, but only one of perfection. Signal.” - It’s not a little long for a T-shirt? Personally, I prefer to emphasize the advantages of Signal without mentioning the competitors.

EDIT:

EDIT2:
Do you think we’re gonna get in trouble with Marvel because it’s too similar to the Iron Man Arc Reactor?

EDIT3:
I’ve just registered “Captain Signal”

posts.name: Jay Patel
posts.cooked: T shirt with QR code to download signal app?

posts.name: ⚠️ abandoned account ⚠️
posts.cooked:
A QR code it’s not really human readable and can therefore be easily “exploited”.
So, better use signal.org

posts.name: Jay Patel
posts.cooked: I mean keep it next to Signal logo also or have QR code back on tshirt and front with Signal logo

posts.name: ⚠️ abandoned account ⚠️
posts.cooked: Personally, I don’t want that people get used to scan QR codes in general. Again, QR codes are easy to exploit. Just distribute 1000 Stickers with Signal logo but with “exploited” URL (QR Code).

posts.name: Adam Parish
posts.cooked: If you need a QR Code to find the Signal App, you probably are fine with the default Samsung SMS app.
